page.title: 15Employment in Whitminster.
page.content:
Continued from page 14.
Finally he set up a camping equipment business which got off the ground about 25 years ago with Mrs Attwooll sewing the tents on her sewing machine at home. As the business became more successful a large factory and warehouse was built on an old orchard. This was opened in 1966. Now the company makes about 100 tents a year. They employ 80 full time staff and an extra 25 in the summer. The warehouse is open from 9 to 5 each day. Soon they hope to computerise their stock control.
Most of the people who work there live locally although most of the material they use comes from France.
Continued on page 16.
